page.title: 21BBC Radio Nan Gaidheal
page.content:
BBC Radio Nan Gaidheal is the only national Gaelic language station in Scotland broadcasting a wide range of programmes, with over 90 hours of programmes broadcast per week. Over 30 staff are employed by the BBC at Rosebank House in Stornoway covering programmes for BBC Radio nan Gaidheal , BBC Alba - Gaelic Language Television and BBC Alba Online. BBC Radio Nan Gaidheal also has studios in Inverness, Glasgow and Portree, with Broadcast Journalists based in Uist and Argyll.

A BBC Trust review of Radio Nan Gaidheal conducted 2010 / 2011 showed that 91 per cent of Radio nan Gaidheal listeners say they would miss the station if it wasn't there; and and 93 per cent say that Radio nan Gaidheal represents value for money.
